January 14, 2011 | header_align = center | header_background = | footer = '''Balloting''' * First Ballot: '''Priebus''' wins plurality; '''45''' * Second Ballot: '''Priebus''' wins plurality; '''52''' * Third Ballot: '''Priebus''' wins plurality; '''54''' * Fourth Ballot: '''Priebus''' wins plurality; '''58'''; ''Steele withdraws, endorses Cino'' * Fifth Ballot: '''Priebus''' wins plurality; '''67''' * Sixth Ballot: '''Priebus''' wins plurality; '''80'''; ''Wagner withdraws'' * Seventh Ballot: '''Priebus''' wins majority over Anuzis and Cino; '''97'''-43-28 '''Results''' *Chairman before election: [[Michael Steele]] ([[Maryland]]) * Chairman after election: [[Reince Priebus]] ([[Wisconsin]]) | footer_align = left | footer_background = | width = | image1 = Reince Priebus by Gage Skidmore.jpg | width1 = 91 | caption1 = [[Republican Party of Wisconsin|Wisconsin GOP Chair]]
[[Reince Priebus]] | image2 = Saul Anuzis.jpg | width2 = 86 | caption2 = Fmr. [[Republican Party of Michigan| Michigan GOP Chair]]
[[Saul Anuzis]] | image3 = Maria Cino DOC official photo.jpg | width3 = 87 | caption3 = Fmr. [[Republican National Committee| Deputy RNC Chair]]
[[Maria Cino]] | image4 = Ann Wagner.jpg | width4 = 77 | caption4 = Fmr. [[Republican Party of Missouri| Missouri GOP Chair]]
[[Ann Wagner]] | image5 = Michael Steele.jpg | width5 = 82 | caption5 = Incumbent [[Republican National Committee| RNC Chair]]
[[Michael Steele]] }} The '''2011 Republican National Committee (RNC) chairmanship election''' was held on January 14, 2011, to determine the next chairman of the RNC, who will serve a two-year term ending in 2013 and will lead the party through the [[United States elections, 2012|2012 general elections]]. After seven rounds of balloting, [[Reince Priebus]] was elected chairman over incumbent chair [[Michael Steele]], [[Saul Anuzis]], [[Ann Wagner]] and [[Maria Cino]].{{cite web|last=Shear |first=Michael D. |url=http://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/01/14/voting-begins-for-rnc-chairman/ |title=Voting Begins for RNC Chairman - NYTimes.com |publisher=Thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com |date=2010-12-19 |accessdate=2011-01-16}} ==Candidates== *[[Saul Anuzis]], National Chairman for the Save American Jobs Project, former [[Republican Party of Michigan|Michigan Republican Party Chairman]]{{cite web|url=http://www.weeklystandard.com/blogs/battle-rnc-begins-former-michigan-gop-chairman-will-challenge-michael-steele_516576.html |title=It's On: Saul Anuzis Will Challenge Michael Steele for RNC Chairmanship |publisher=Weekly Standard |date=2010-11-12 |accessdate=2011-01-16}} *[[Maria Cino]], Political Director of [[George W. Bush presidential campaign, 2000|George Bush's 2000 Campaign]]{{cite web|url=http://blogs.abcnews.com/thenote/2010/12/maria-cino-officially-enters-the-race-for-rnc-chair.html |title=Maria Cino Officially Enters Race For RNC Chair - The Note |publisher=Blogs.abcnews.com |date=2010-12-11 |accessdate=2011-01-16}} *[[Reince Priebus]], Chairman of the [[Republican Party of Wisconsin]]{{cite news| url = http://www.politico.com/news/stories/1210/46005.html| title = Reince Priebus runs for RNC chairman| author = Martin, Jonathan| work = Poltiico| date = December 6, 2010| accessdate = January 8, 2011}} *[[Michael Steele]], incumbent Committee Chairman, former [[Lieutenant Governor of Maryland]]{{cite web|last=Choe |first=Jaywon |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-503544_162-20009909-503544.html |title=What's Next for Michael Steele and the RNC? |publisher=Cbsnews.com |date=2010-07-07 |accessdate=2011-01-16}}{{cite web|author=Doug McKelway |url=http://politics.blogs.foxnews.com/2010/12/13/sources-say-steele-will-seek-second-term-rnc-chair |title=Sources Say Steele Will Seek Second Term As RNC Chair |publisher=Politics.blogs.foxnews.com |date=2010-04-07 |accessdate=2011-01-16}} *[[Ann Wagner]], former [[United States Ambassador to Luxembourg]], former [[Republican Party of Missouri|Missouri Republican Party Chairman]]{{cite web |url=http://voices.washingtonpost.com/thefix/republican-party/wagner-launches-bid-for-rnc-ch.html |title=Wagner launches bid for RNC chair |last=Blake |first=Aaron |date=November 29, 2010 |work=voices.washingtonpost.com |publisher=Washington Post |accessdate=November 29, 2010}} ;Former candidates who withdrew before voting began *[[Gentry Collins]], Former Political Director of the RNC,{{cite web|last=Smith |first=Ben |url=http://www.politico.com/blogs/bensmith/0111/Exit_Collins.html?showall |title=Exit Collins - Ben Smith |publisher=Politico.Com |date=2011-01-02 |accessdate=2011-01-16}} withdrew on January 2, 2010 *[[Gary Emineth]], Chairman of the [[North Dakota Republican Party]] {{cite web|url=http://www.bismarcktribune.com/news/local/govt-and-politics/article_2a35b33e-f280-11df-98f5-001cc4c03286.html |title=Emineth not seeking national GOP chairmanship, state position gets candidates |publisher=Bismarcktribune.com |date=2010-11-17 |accessdate=2011-01-16}} ==Timeline== * [[December 13]], [[2010]] - Incumbent Chair Steele announces bid for re-election. * [[January 3]], [[2011]] - Candidate debate held by [[Americans for Tax Reform]] at the [[National Press Club (USA)|National Press Club]] * [[January 14]], [[2011]] - Election held by party voting members in [[Washington, D.C.]] ==Debates== A debate among the candidates hosted by [[Americans for Tax Reform]] took place on January 3, 2011 at the National Press Club.{{cite web|last=Brenton |first=Hannah |url=http://thehill.com/blogs/ballot-box/campaign-committees/135131-rnc-race-still-a-toss-up-as-steele-defends-rocky-tenure |title=Race for RNC chairman remains a 'toss-up' as Steele defends tenure - The Hill's Ballot Box |publisher=Thehill.com |date= |accessdate=2011-01-16}} Anuzis, Cino, Priebus, Steele, and Wagner participated in the debate.{{cite web|last=Shear |first=Michael D. |url=http://thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com/2011/01/03/steele-to-debate-rivals-for-r-n-c-post-monday/?hp |title=Steele to Debate Rivals for R.N.C. Post - NYTimes.com |publisher=Thecaucus.blogs.nytimes.com |date=2011-01-03 |accessdate=2011-01-16}} *[http://www.c-spanvideo.org/program/ChairD Republican Committee Chair Debate], ''[[C-SPAN]]'', January 3, 2011, full video ==Polling== A poll by the ''[[National Journal]]'', released on January 13, 2011, showed Priebus in the lead with 40 committed votes out of 168, Steele 17, Wagner 15, Anuzis 14, and Cino 12. ==Results== With 168 voting members of the RNC, 85 votes were required to win the chairmanship. {|class="wikitable" |- ! Candidate ! Round 1 ! Round 2 ! Round 3 ! Round 4 ! Round 5 ! Round 6 ! Round 7 |- | [[Reince Priebus]] | style="background:cornflowerblue;"|45 | style="background:cornflowerblue;"|52 | style="background:cornflowerblue;"|54 | style="background:cornflowerblue;"|58 | style="background:cornflowerblue;"|67 | style="background:cornflowerblue;"|80 | style="background:limegreen;"|97 |- | [[Saul Anuzis]] |24 |22 |21 |24 |32 |37 |43 |- | [[Maria Cino]] |32 |30 |28 |29 |40 |34 |28 |- | [[Ann Wagner]] |23 |27 |32 |28 |28 |17 | style="background:lightgrey;"|''Withdrew'' |- | [[Michael Steele]] |44 |37 |33 |28 |colspan="3" style="background:lightgrey; text-align:center"|''Withdrew'' |} :{{colorbox|limegreen}} Candidate won majority of votes in the round :{{colorbox|cornflowerblue}} Candidate secured a plurality of votes in the round :{{colorbox|lightgrey}} Candidate withdrew ==References== {{Reflist|2}} {{Republican Party (United States)}} [[Category:Republican Party (United States) organizations|National Committee]] [[Category:2011 in American politics|Republican National Committee Chairmanship Election, 2011]] [[Category:Michael Steele]]
